# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return lowercase(strip(col)) |> replace => "-" => "_"
end
```
This function uses `lowercase` to convert the string to lowercase, `strip` to remove leading and trailing whitespace, and `replace` with a substitution rule to replace hyphens with underscores. The pipe operator (`|>`) is used to chain these functions together into a single expression.
